headline: Are Amazon's layoffs signaling anything about broader economy?
summary: Amazon (AMZN) announced on Tuesday that it will be laying off 14,000 corporate workers. This comes a day after Reuters initially reported that firings could reach up to 30,000 roles. As part of Opening Bid's panel of expert guests and reporters, Prairie Operating Co. EVP Market Strategy Lou Basenese weighs in on what Amazon's layoffs could signal about the broader labor market conditions. Amazon is scheduled to report third quarter earnings results after the market close on Thursday, October 30. Basenese is also the founder of TheBigSkinny.com. To watch more expert insights and analysis on the latest market action, check out more Opening Bid.

headline: Fed lookahead, Amazon layoffs, earnings latest: 3 Things
summary: US stock futures (ES=F, NQ=F, YM=F) are moving in positive territory on Tuesday morning as Wall Street looks ahead to the Federal Reserve's interest rate decision and the first round of Big Tech earnings results tomorrow. Magnificent Seven companies Meta Platforms (META), Microsoft (MSFT), and Alphabet (GOOGL, GOOG) will be reporting quarterly results on Wednesday, and Amazon (AMZN) and Apple (AAPL) will publish their releases on Thursday. Amazon laid off 14,000 corporate workers on Tuesday after Reuters originally reported on Monday that firings could reach up to 30,000 roles. UnitedHealth Group (UNH), United Parcel Service (UPS), and PayPal (PYPL) all reported third quarter earnings results and their shares are all seeing a boost in pre-market trading. To watch more expert insights and analysis on the latest market action, check out more Morning Brief.

headline: Amazon cuts 14,000 corporate jobs as spending on artificial intelligence accelerates
summary: Amazon will cut about 14,000 corporate jobs as the online retail giant ramps up spending on artificial intelligence. The reductions we're sharing today are a continuation of this work to get even stronger by further reducing bureaucracy, removing layers, and shifting resources to ensure we're investing in our biggest bets and what matters most to our customers' current and future needs,” Beth Galetti, Senior Vice President of People Experience and Technology at Amazon said in message to employees Tuesday. Included in the letter was a memo to Amazon staff last year from CEO Andy Jassy, Teams and individuals impacted by the job cuts will be notified on Tuesday.

raw.headline: Amazon cuts 14,000 corporate jobs as spending on artificial intelligence accelerates
raw.summary: Amazon will cut about 14,000 corporate jobs as the online retail giant ramps up spending on artificial intelligence. The reductions we're sharing today are a continuation of this work to get even stronger by further reducing bureaucracy, removing layers, and shifting resources to ensure we're investing in our biggest bets and what matters most to our customers' current and future needs,” Beth Galetti, Senior Vice President of People Experience and Technology at Amazon said in message to employees Tuesday. Included in the letter was a memo to Amazon staff last year from CEO Andy Jassy, Teams and individuals impacted by the job cuts will be notified on Tuesday.

headline: Amazon says it plans to cut about 14,000 corporate jobs
summary: Amazon's corporate workforce includes roughly 350,000 employees.  Reuters first reported on Monday that Amazon is planning to cut as many as 30,000 corporate jobs beginning on Tuesday, as the company compensates for over-hiring during the peak demand of the pandemic.  Amazon has been restructuring its workforce across multiple divisions in recent months, with piecemeal job cuts across its books, devices and services unit, as well as its Wondery podcast division.

headline: Amazon aims to cut as many as 30,000 corporate jobs: sources
summary: STORY: Amazon is planning its biggest job cuts since 2022. It's aiming to axe as many as 30,000 corporate positions starting Tuesday.According to three people familiar with the matter, the e-commerce giant is paring back expenses and compensating for overhiring during the peak demand of the pandemic.The figure is roughly 10% of Amazon's corporate employees.Cuts beginning this week may affect teams such as human resources, operations, and Amazon Web Services.Amazon CEO Andy Jassy said in June artificial intelligence tools would likely lead to more job cuts, automating repetitive and routine tasks.Earlier this year, he installed an anonymous complaint line for identifying inefficiencies.Sources say Amazon's five-day back-to-office policy - among tech's most stringent - has failed to generate enough attrition.The sources cite that as another reason for the size of the layoff.Some of the employees who are not swiping in daily because they live far from corporate offices, or for other reasons, are being told they have voluntarily quit Amazon and must leave without severance, a saving for the company.Meanwhile, Amazon appears to be expecting another big holiday selling season.It plans to offer 250,000 seasonal jobs to help staff warehouses and other needs, the same as in the past two years.

raw.headline: Amazon aims to cut as many as 30,000 corporate jobs: sources
raw.summary: STORY: Amazon is planning its biggest job cuts since 2022. It's aiming to axe as many as 30,000 corporate positions starting Tuesday.According to three people familiar with the matter, the e-commerce giant is paring back expenses and compensating for overhiring during the peak demand of the pandemic.The figure is roughly 10% of Amazon's corporate employees.Cuts beginning this week may affect teams such as human resources, operations, and Amazon Web Services.Amazon CEO Andy Jassy said in June artificial intelligence tools would likely lead to more job cuts, automating repetitive and routine tasks.Earlier this year, he installed an anonymous complaint line for identifying inefficiencies.Sources say Amazon's five-day back-to-office policy - among tech's most stringent - has failed to generate enough attrition.The sources cite that as another reason for the size of the layoff.Some of the employees who are not swiping in daily because they live far from corporate offices, or for other reasons, are being told they have voluntarily quit Amazon and must leave without severance, a saving for the company.Meanwhile, Amazon appears to be expecting another big holiday selling season.It plans to offer 250,000 seasonal jobs to help staff warehouses and other needs, the same as in the past two years.

headline: Amazon to cut nearly 30K corporate jobs in largest layoff in company history: report
summary: The biggest corporate layoff in Amazon’s history will reportedly eliminate 30,000 jobs across multiple divisions as part of a major restructuring effort.
